key_points: Tom Brady is launching a new fashion label named 'Brady'.
The brand will debut in December and features activewear and training clothes.
Brady is collaborating with Jens Grede, Skims cofounder, and Dao-Yi Chow, cofounder of Public School New York.
Jens Grede will serve as the brand's cofounder and CEO.
The goal is to make 'Brady' one of the largest namesake sportswear brands, comparable to Michael Jordan's Jordan Brand.
Grede has a history of building successful direct-to-consumer fashion brands like Skims and Good American.
Combined revenue from Grede's brands (Skims, Good American, Frame) is expected to reach $500 million in 2021.
The 'Brady' brand has been in development for three years.
Grede's involvement hints at a highly anticipated launch and potential future success.
The label aims to create the finest sports brand in the world.
spokespersons: Dao-Yi Chow (Cofounder, Public School New York)
